timetable_parser.scheduleitem module¶

Module Containing a Single Class: ScheduleItem

class timetable_parser.scheduleitem.ScheduleItem(day_number, time_hour, duration_hours, data, module_list)[source]¶

Object Representing a Single Element of a timetable .. attribute:: day_number

in [1,2,3,4,5]
day_string in ["Monday",Tuesday....]
duration_hours in [1,2...] (usually 1 or 2)
hour_range¶

e.g. item at 11pm for 2 hours have hour range [11,12]

lecturer¶

e.g. “Professor X”

module_code¶

e.g. “COMP1234”

module_number¶

Integer mostly used for module ordering

room¶

e.g. “E216A”

schedule_title¶

e.g. “Theory of Computation Lecture”

schedule_type¶

e.g. Usually LECT or TUT

time_hour¶

in [1...7] (representing 9am to 5pm start times

time_string¶

Printable Representation of time, e.g. 18:00

uid [day_string, time_string,

module_name, schedule_type ]

weeks¶

list of weeks the item is on, e.g. if the item runs from weeks 11-20, then weeks = [11,12,.....20]

weeks_string¶

If item runs from weeks 11-20, then weeks_string is “11-20”

__eq__(other)[source]¶

Checks for equality with another object Objects are equal if they have the same hash value

__hash__()[source]¶

Returns a integer determined by the uid list converts the list into a integer uniquely defined by its uid

clash(x)[source]¶

Determines whether to ScheduleItems clash: Checks for intersection of their hours and weeks

static parse_schedule_title(schedule_title)[source]¶

Takes a string defining the schedule title and standardises it e.g. “Tutorial A” -> “Tutorial”

static parse_time_string(time)[source]¶

Converts integer time to String representation e.g. 8.25 -> “8:15”

static parse_weeks(week_string)[source]¶

Takes a string of form “11-20,21-30” and return a list of form [11,12...20,21....30]

static set_schedule_type(schedule_type)[source]¶

Takes a string defining the type of schedule item and standardises it e.g. “LEC” -> “LECT”

table_entries = None¶

Parsing table_entries list: ->P:Find by array position ->C:Find by font color ____________________________ P:Red:ModuleCode/ScheduleType P:Blue: ??? P:Black:Module Title

C:Black:Week Numbers C:Green:Lecturer C:Brown: Room Numbers ____________________________

to_string()[source]¶

Returns a string representation of the uid
